headline: New election rules spice up Paris, Marseille and Lyon mayor races
subhead: The voting system in France's three largest cities will change in the March municipal elections, allowing voters to cast their ballots directly for central city councilors. The novelty has disrupted the political balance and made traditional strongholds less essential.

headline: US Secret Service kills man trying to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate
Top Mexican drug cartel leader killed
Hong Kong appeals court upholds prison sentences for 12 pro-democracy activists
subhead: The Hong Kong opposition figures had their appeals dismissed, with their sentences ranging from four years and two months to 10 years, in a ruling that highlights the severity of Beijing's control over Hong Kong's politics.

headline: India, the world's leading dairy producer, struggles to rid its market of adulterated milk
subhead: Water is often added to Indian milk, but so are chemicals and vegetable oils. The quality of Indian dairy products is therefore frequently questionable, a fact highlighted by a recent scandal in the state of Gujarat.

headline: Park Chan-wook, director of 'No Other Choice,' still believes in the power of collective values
subhead: The South Korean filmmaker, known for his keen attention to class struggle, brings a sharp social fable to the screen with his adaptation of Donald Westlake's novel 'The Ax,' laced with biting humor.

headline: Donald Trump's support with 'bro culture' is waning
subhead: With his racist post about the Obamas, support for immigration police and decision to politicize Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny's halftime Super Bowl show, the US president has alienated some of his supporters.

New York's Mayor Mamdani orders citywide travel ban as major storm hits US

AI has arrived in France's local elections – for better or worse
In Lyon, the far right pays tribute to activist and tries to avoid controversy
subhead: Around 3,200 people marched peacefully on Saturday afternoon to condemn 'the far left,' one week after Quentin Deranque's death. The local authorities reported Nazi salutes and racist and homophobic slurs to the courts.

headline: At the Paris Agricultural Show, Macron visits in relative calm
subhead: In the absence of the traditional breakfast with agricultural unions – some of which boycotted his visit – the president held bilateral talks with the FNSEA and Coordination Rurale. He then toured the exhibition under heavy police protection.

headline: Karyna Shuliak was Jeffrey Epstein's last partner and main heiress. She won't benefit from his will
subhead: The Belarusian woman met the sexual predator when she was 20 and remained loyal to him until his suicide in prison in 2019.

headline: Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'What is, ultimately, the point of sending humans into space?'
'For the British monarchy, the stakes of the Epstein files go far beyond the individual case of a compromised prince'
